body:
I'm making this thread just to address the questions pertaining to my demotion from Moderator.

So for the past few weeks you may or may not have seen a change in my attitude but I had been treating the Admins somewhat rashly.  

I got demoted for "Immaturity and Disrespect". I do agree on part of the demotion as there were clear evidence supporting half of it but the other half was just not supported with sufficient and strong evidence. I was given a staff warning but after that I felt that I toned down a little but I guess that's not what the admins thought.

So, you may ask, what did I do? I tried to step up for those moderators, whom was afraid to do so against the seniors, who felt that a change is needed in the seniors by giving them feedback on how they can improve. However, I gave them a tone which wasn't pleasant and I admit that I was a little rash. I just hope they'll consider what I said to them and take out the rash bits to actually realise what's the main purpose of me giving them feedback to improve on the staff team. 

I would also like to take the opportunity to apologise to whoever I have offended or treated badly for the past few weeks. 

I'll still be around, just not in the staff team. Hit me up on slack or skype if you have anything to ask me.
body_tagged:

I was given a staff warning but after that I felt that I toned down a little but I guess that's not what the admins thought.

So, you may ask, what did I do? I tried to step up for those moderators, whom was afraid to do so against the seniors, who felt that a change is needed in the seniors by giving them feedback on how they can improve. However, I gave them a tone which wasn't pleasant and I admit that I was a little rash. I just hope they'll consider what I said to them and take out the rash bits to actually realise what's the main purpose of me giving them feedback to improve on the staff team. 

I would also like to take the opportunity to apologise to whoever I have offended or treated badly for the past few weeks. 

I'll still be around, just not in the staff team. Hit me up on slack or skype if you have anything to ask me.

replies.body: Well there are different ways of giving opinions. Not saying Eteh fell under one of these but here is how I see it. There are people who give opinions and feedback in a calm and respectful manner. Then there are the people who do it in the sense of talking down to them, bashing them, swearing, and such. If you want to give proper feedback you will not be punished for constructive criticism. On the other hand people do get punished for destructive criticism.

Then there are the people who do it in the sense of talking down to them, bashing them, swearing, and such. If you want to give proper feedback you will not be punished for constructive criticism.

I didn't talk down on the Admins, I didn't bash them, I didn't use any vulgarity when I gave them feedback on slack. Lastly, I gave them constructive critism and not "destructive critism". Sure, for whatever reason you guys may take offense to whatever tone I use (you can't judge a person's tone off textual form) but if you actually do see and get what I'm trying to say and actually take it into consideration, maybe you guys will start seeing what you're lacking and how you guys should have improved on.

replies.body: Freedom of speech is the right to communicate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used.
replies.body_tagged: Freedom of speech is the right to communicate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used.

reply_to.body: Freedom of speech doesn't mean you have the right to say whatever you want. ;)
